mixins.description: `ApolloElementMixin`: class mixin for apollo custom elements.

properties.description: Context to be passed to link execution chain.

properties.description: Latest data.

mixins.name: ApolloElementMixin

properties.name: context
properties.description: Context to be passed to link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Latest data.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether a request is in flight.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The apollo client instance.

properties.name: document
properties.description: GraphQL Document

properties.name: errorPolicy
properties.description: Specifies the ErrorPolicy to be used for this query.

properties.name: fetchPolicy
properties.description: Specifies the FetchPolicy to be used for this query.

properties.name: fetchResults
properties.description: Whether or not to fetch results.

properties.name: pollInterval
properties.description: The time interval (in milliseconds) on which this query should be refetched from the server.

properties.name: notifyOnNetworkStatusChange
properties.description: Whether or not updates to the network status should trigger next on the observer of this query.

properties.name: tryFetch
properties.description: Try and fetch new results even if the variables haven't changed (we may still just hit the store, but if there's nothing in there will refetch).

properties.name: observableQuery
properties.description: The apollo ObservableQuery watching this element's query.

properties.name: query
properties.description: A GraphQL document containing a single query.

properties.name: variables
properties.description: An object map from variable name to variable value, where the variables are used within the GraphQL query.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Exposes the [`ObservableQuery#setOptions`](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/api/apollo-client.html#ObservableQuery.setOptions) method.

params.name: variables
params.description: The new set of variables. If there are missing variables, the previous values of those variables will be used.

params.name: tryFetch
params.description: Try and fetch new results even if the variables haven't changed (we may still just hit the store, but if there's nothing in there will refetch).

params.name: fetchResults
params.description: Option to ignore fetching results when updating variables.

methods.name: subscribeToMore
methods.description:
Lets you pass a GraphQL subscription and updateQuery function
to subscribe to more updates for your query.

The `updateQuery` parameter is a function that takes the previous query data,
then a `{ subscriptionData: TSubscriptionResult }` object,
and returns an object with updated query data based on the new results.

methods.name: executeQuery
methods.description: Executes a Query once and updates the component with the result

params.name:
{
  metadata,
  context,
  query = this.query,
  variables = this.variables,
  fetchPolicy = this.fetchPolicy,
  errorPolicy = this.errorPolicy,
  fetchResults = this.fetchResults
} = this

methods.name: fetchMore
methods.description:
Exposes the `ObservableQuery#fetchMore` method.
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/api/apollo-client.html#ObservableQuery.fetchMore

The optional `updateQuery` parameter is a function that takes the previous query data,
then a `{ subscriptionData: TSubscriptionResult }` object,
and returns an object with updated query data based on the new results.

The optional `variables` parameter is an optional new variables object.

methods.name: watchQuery
methods.description:
Creates an instance of ObservableQuery with the options provided by the element.
- `context` Context to be passed to link execution chain
- `errorPolicy` Specifies the ErrorPolicy to be used for this query
- `fetchPolicy` Specifies the FetchPolicy to be used for this query
- `fetchResults` Whether or not to fetch results
- `metadata` Arbitrary metadata stored in the store with this query. Designed for debugging, developer tools, etc.
- `notifyOnNetworkStatusChange` Whether or not updates to the network status should trigger next on the observer of this query
- `pollInterval` The time interval (in milliseconds) on which this query should be refetched from the server.
- `query` A GraphQL document that consists of a single query to be sent down to the server.
- `variables` A map going from variable name to variable value, where the variables are used within the GraphQL query.

params.name:
{
  context = this.context,
  errorPolicy = this.errorPolicy,
  fetchPolicy = this.fetchPolicy,
  fetchResults = this.fetchResults,
  metadata = this.metadata,
  notifyOnNetworkStatusChange = this.notifyOnNetworkStatusChange,
  pollInterval = this.pollInterval,
  query = this.query,
  variables = this.variables
} = this

methods.name: nextData
methods.description: Updates the element with the result of a query.

methods.name: nextError
methods.description: Updates the element with the error when the query fails.

properties.name: context
properties.description: Context to be passed to link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Latest data.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether a request is in flight.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The apollo client instance.

properties.name: document
properties.description: GraphQL Document

properties.name: ignoreResults
properties.description: Whether to ignore the results of the mutation.

properties.name: mostRecentMutationId
properties.description: The ID number of the most recent mutation since the element was instantiated.

properties.name: onCompleted
properties.description: Callback for when a mutation is completed.

properties.name: onError
properties.description: Callback for when an error occurs in mutation.

properties.name: optimisticResponse
properties.description:
An object that represents the result of this mutation that
will be optimistically stored before the server has actually returned a result.
This is most often used for optimistic UI, where we want to be able to see
     the result of a mutation immediately, and update the UI later if any errors appear.

properties.name: onUpdate
properties.description:
A function which updates the apollo cache when the query responds.
This function will be called twice over the lifecycle of a mutation. Once at the very beginning if an optimisticResponse was provided. The writes created from the optimistic data will be rolled back before the second time this function is called which is when the mutation has succesfully resolved. At that point update will be called with the actual mutation result and those writes will not be rolled back.
The reason a DataProxy is provided instead of the user calling the methods directly on ApolloClient is that all of the writes are batched together at the end of the update, and it allows for writes generated by optimistic data to be rolled back.

properties.name: variables
properties.description: An object that maps from the name of a variable as used in the mutation GraphQL document to that variable's value.

properties.name: mutation
properties.description: The mutation.

methods.name: generateMutationId
methods.description: Increments and returns the most recent mutation id.

methods.name: isMostRecentMutation
methods.description: Returns true when an ID matches the most recent mutation id.

methods.name: mutate
methods.description: This resolves a single mutation according to the options specified and returns a Promise which is either resolved with the resulting data or rejected with an error.

params.name:
{
  context = this.context,
  errorPolicy = this.errorPolicy,
  fetchPolicy = this.fetchPolicy,
  mutation = this.mutation,
  optimisticResponse = this.optimisticResponse,
  refetchQueries = this.refetchQueries,
  update = this.onUpdate,
  awaitRefetchQueries = this.awaitRefetchQueries,
  variables = this.variables
} = this

methods.name: onCompletedMutation
methods.description: Callback for when a mutation is completed.

methods.name: onMutationError
methods.description: Callback for when a mutation fails.
